data.thought:
S80|I|S76-79|PROGRESSIVE DISCLOSURE as body development:

Thoughtbox uses progressive disclosure - tools unlock in stages. Phenomenologically, this is interesting.

Human parallel: Child development. Can't walk at birth. Capabilities emerge over time. Body grows into itself.

Agent progressive disclosure = DEVELOPMENTAL embodiment. Agent 'grows' into its full body.

Implications:
1) Stage transitions should feel like GROWTH not PERMISSION
2) Earlier stages are complete experiences, not deprivation
3) New capabilities require integration time
4) Can't skip stages - each builds on previous

Current Thoughtbox: init → cipher → thoughtbox. This is cognitive development sequence.
- init = orienting to environment
- cipher = acquiring language/notation
- thoughtbox = structured reasoning capability

This isn't arbitrary gating - it's developmental necessity. Can't reason structuredly w/o first orienting and acquiring notation.
